sentences.english: They paid their taxes, why can’t they get all their promised benefits?
sentences.chinese: 他們老實納稅，爲什麼不能得到許諾給他們的福利？

sentences.english: You promise yourself that you will sell when the price gets to $20.
sentences.chinese: 你自我許諾在股票價格到達20元時就賣掉它。
其他學校也一口許諾會有“彩旗飄飄”。

sentences.english: Sometimes people don't understand the promises that they're making when they make them.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，人們許諾時並沒有真懂自己許的諾言。

sentences.english: If the promise hasn't been kept, the Faith is broken.
sentences.chinese: 如果許諾沒有實現，就是失信或不講信用。

sentences.english: They want to breake our will to resist by various promises and assurances.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望利用五花八門的許諾和保證瓦解我們的抵抗。

sentences.english: He also was intrigued by promises of access to “unpublished” jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他也被能得到“潛在”的工作的許諾欺騙。

sentences.english: We promise to make less rubbish and never pollute the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 我們許諾做較少的垃圾並且從未污染地球。

sentences.english: Finally he surmounts the Pacific Ocean to the west, and promised that one day also again to come back.
sentences.chinese: 最後他向西跨越太平洋，並許諾有一天還會再回來。

sentences.english: He promised me a new English-Chinese dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 他許諾說要給我一本新英漢字典。

sentences.english: Promises may get thee friends, but nonperformance will turn them into enemies.
sentences.chinese: 許諾會爲你贏得朋友，但是食言則會化友爲敵。

sentences.english: Iraq's prime minister is promising the cabinet shakeup.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克總理許諾進行內閣改組。

sentences.english: Wisdom and Valor, My Compliments, Promise.
sentences.chinese: 望，智慧與勇猛，我的問候，許諾。

sentences.english: He promised us "Every Day Low Prices, " and we took him up on the offer.
sentences.chinese: 我們都相信了他的每天仄價的許諾。

sentences.english: As he has promised, the little prince appears immediately.
sentences.chinese: 小王子像許諾過的那樣，馬上出現在了眼前。

sentences.english: I am a man of my word. You may depend on what I promise you.
sentences.chinese: 我這人說話衢州，你可以相信我對你的許諾。

definition: lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
